duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide outreach to adults, children and families, and assist in the screening, engagement, and admission of individuals into the Certified Community Behavioral Health Clinic.
Assess needs, make referrals, gather outcome data, and follow up with clients related to care transitions and accessing medical care.
Serve as a liaison with community partners to coordinate care and assist clients in accessing outpatient mental health services.
Conduct all aspects of the job in an ethical manner in support of the facility’s commitment to ethical behavior in all areas of personal and professional activity.
Be aware of department compliance requirements for federally funded healthcare programs regarding fraud, waste, and abuse.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in social work or human services related field preferred. High school diploma or equivalency required.
